item.title: Kseniya add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by Jane Addams
item.description: "The good we secure for ourselves is precarious and uncertain until it is secured for all of us and incorporated into our common life." -- Jane Addams

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by Jane Smiley
item.description: "Many people, myself among them, feel better at the mere sight of a book." -- Jane Smiley

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by Paul Simon
item.description: "It's actually very difficult to make something both simple and good." -- Paul Simon

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "I read so I can live more than one life in more than one place." -- Anne Tyler

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by Federico Fellini
item.description: "All art is autobiographical; the pearl is the oyster's autobiography." -- Federico Fellini

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by Colette
item.description: "I went to collect the few personal belongings which...I held to be invaluable: my cat, my resolve to travel, and my solitude." -- Colette

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by Stewart O'Nan
item.description: "You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved." -- Stewart O'Nan

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by George Moore
item.description: "We humans are more complicated than animals, and we love through the imagination." -- George Moore

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by Phyllis McGinley
item.description: "A bit of trash now and then is good for the severest reader. It provides the necessary roughage in the literary diet." -- Phyllis McGinley

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Angry, and half in love with her, and tremendously sorry, I turned away." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by Edward Lear
item.description: "The Owl and the Pussy-cat went to sea In a beautiful pea green boat..." -- Edward Lear

item.title: Kseniya add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description:
"When describing nature, a writer should seize upon small details, arranging them so that the reader will see an image in his mind after he closes his eyes. For instance: you will capture the truth of a moonlit night if you'll write that a gleam like starlight shone from the pieces of a broken bottle, and then the dark, plump shadow of a dog or wolf appeared. You will bring life to nature only if you don't shrink from similes that liken its activities to those of humankind."
(<i>Letter to Alexander Chekhov</i>, May 10, 1886)" -- Anton Chekhov
